title: 111_s224
content:
The "Green Jobs and Infrastructure Act of 2009" includes provisions for clean technology manufacturing incentives, advanced technology vehicles manufacturing incentives, energy efficiency and conservation block grants, and green energy jobs. The Act defines the term "Secretary" as the Secretary of Energy. TITLE I--CLEAN TECHNOLOGY MANUFACTURING INCENTIVE PROGRAM

SEC. 101. CLEAN TECHNOLOGY MANUFACTURING INCENTIVE PROGRAM. The Secretary provides loans to manufacturers in the United States for reequipping, expanding, or establishing manufacturing facilities to produce clean technology products like wind turbines, solar energy products, fuel cells, advanced batteries, biomass engines, geothermal equipment, ocean energy equipment, carbon capture and storage, and energy efficiency products. The Secretary provides loans to manufacturers in the United States for reequipping, expanding, or establishing manufacturing facilities to produce clean technology products like wind turbines, solar energy products, fuel cells, advanced batteries, biomass engines, geothermal equipment, ocean energy equipment, carbon capture and storage, and energy efficiency products. This includes improving energy efficiency by at least 30 percent over a baseline product and retrofitting manufacturing facilities with technologies such as combined heat and power systems, natural gas pressure recovery, advanced cogeneration, gasification, anaerobic digestion, and landfill gas recovery. The Secretary provides loans to manufacturers for improving energy efficiency in industrial processes through clean technology retooling, retrofitting, and worker training costs. Loans are available for facilities and equipment placed in service before December 30, 2012, and costs incurred until December 30, 2020, totaling up to $50,000,000,000. The Secretary can provide loans up to $50,000,000,000 to eligible individuals and entities for activities described in subsection (a). Applicants must submit an application with wage assurances, and the Secretary will select eligible projects to receive loans. The Secretary will select eligible projects to receive loans under this subsection based on market viability, efficient use of funds, job creation or preservation, and other criteria established by the Secretary. Loans will have an interest rate determined by the Secretary. The loan shall have an interest rate equal to the cost of funds to the Department of the Treasury, a term of up to 25 years, repayment deferral for up to 5 years after project operations begin, and will be made by the Federal Financing Bank. The loan under this section will be made by the Federal Financing Bank and must be repaid in full if production is moved outside the US. Administrative costs should not exceed $100,000 or 10 basis points of the loan. Priority is given to facilities in high unemployment regions, and idle facilities may also receive awards or loans. The Secretary will coordinate with the Secretary of Commerce for the Manufacturing Extension Partnership Program. The Secretary of Commerce will receive funds from the Treasury for loans and loan guarantees to support the Manufacturing Extension Partnership Program. The Secretary of Commerce will receive and use funds transferred for the Manufacturing Extension Partnership Program without further appropriation. TITLE II--ADVANCED TECHNOLOGY VEHICLES MANUFACTURING INCENTIVE PROGRAM - SEC. 201. ADVANCED TECHNOLOGY VEHICLES MANUFACTURING INCENTIVE PROGRAM. Section 136 of the Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007 is amended to increase funding from 30 percent to 80 percent and provide mandatory funding for awards and loans within 30 days of enactment. The cost of awards and loans for this section is $1,000,000,000, to be available until expended. The Secretary is authorized to receive and use the funds without further appropriation. TITLE III--ENERGY EFFICIENCY AND CONSERVATION BLOCK GRANTS

SEC. 301. ENERGY EFFICIENCY AND CONSERVATION BLOCK GRANTS. Section 548 of the Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007 is amended to provide mandatory funding of $10 billion to the Secretary of the Treasury for the Green Jobs and Infrastructure Act of 2009, with funds available until expended. The Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007 amends Section 548 to allocate grants funds under the Green Jobs and Infrastructure Act of 2009, with 49 percent distributed using alternative 1 and 49 percent using alternative 2 for eligible local government units. TITLE IV--GREEN ENERGY JOBS

SEC. 401. CLEAN ENERGY SERVICE CORPS. Section 122(a) of the National and Community Service Act of 1990 is amended to include a Clean Energy Service Corps program that promotes clean energy technologies and energy efficiency. Priority is given to programs that train participants for careers in a sustainable economy. Section 171(e)(8) of the Workforce Investment Act of 1998 is amended to provide mandatory funding of $625,000,000 for the Green Jobs and Infrastructure Act of 2009, to be transferred from the Treasury to the Secretary for implementation. The Secretary is authorized to receive and use funds without further appropriation for the Green Jobs and Infrastructure Act of 2009. Additionally, $125,000,000 is authorized to be appropriated annually for this subsection.
